meanings.definition: To show fear or lack of courage.
meanings.sent1: She was chickening out of the haunted house.
meanings.sent2: He kept chickening when it was time to speak up.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was chickening about the dark closet.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was chickening at the thought of bungee jumping.
meanings.sent5: The team was chickening at the sight of the opponent's size.

meanings.definition: The act of backing out or avoiding a situation out of fear.
meanings.sent2: The chickening of the students led to a canceled trip.
meanings.sent3: The chickening of the cat from the vet was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The chickening of the squirrel from the dog was swift.
meanings.sent5: The chickening of the driver caused a traffic jam.
